name: Education01
description: Are children in the relevant group likely to have better or worse early years outcomes?

name: Education02
description: Do children and young people in the relevant group do better or worse than others in national assessments? (Phonics; SPAG; KS1; KS2; GCSE)

name: Education03
description: What are progress / attainment levels for the relevant group compared with others?

name: Education04
description: How do Positive Outcomes in the relevant group compare?

name: Education05
description: Are children in the relevant group more or less likely to get their first choice of school?

name: Education06
description: Are children in the relevant group more or less likely to be at: schools in special measures/outstanding schools?

name: Education07
description: Are children in the relevant group more or less likely to attend: selective schools; comprehensive schools, academies?

name: Education08
description: Are people in the relevant group more or less likely to be NEETS?

name: Education09
description: How do participation rates for the relevant group by main Adult Further Education programmes compare with others?

name: Education10
description: How do the number of applicants for Higher Education compare with others in the relevant group?

name: Education11
description: How do the number of Higher Education applications made to each provider group (based on selectivity) compare with others in the relevant group?

name: Education12
description: How do the number of acceptances to each Higher Education provider group compare with others in the relevant group?

name: Education13
description: How does entry to Higher Education compare with others in the relevant group? (% representation in each provider group)

name: Education14
description: How does progress in Higher Education compare with others in the relevant group? (% not continuing in each provider group)

name: Education15
description: How do Higher Education achievements compare with others in the relevant group (% upper class degrees in each provider group)

name: Education16
description: How do destinations after GCSE/A-LEVEL/Uni etc compare with others in the relevant group?

name: Education17
description: How do graduate employment outcomes compare with others in the relevant group? (% employed from each provider group; % employed with an upper class degree)

name: Education18
description: How do the number/rate of permanent/fixed period exclusions compare with others in the relevant group? (early years, primary, secondary, SEN)

name: Education19
description: How do the number/rate of absences/persistent absences compare with others in the relevant group? (primary, secondary, SEN etc)

name: Education20
description: Are children in the relevant group more or less likely to receive SEN support or an EHC plan?

description: Are people in the relevant group more or less likely to be employed in school senior leadership posts?

name: Education23
description: Are people in the relevant group in school-based jobs paid more or less than others?
